reg:regulation.reg:title: Gas Safety Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [Last amended October 1, 2023 by B.C. Reg. 145/2022 and includes amendments by B.C. Reg. 200/2023]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for the Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of the Act:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: gas equipment means anything used or designed to be used in connection with gas and includes any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: piping;
appliances;
fuel containers;
vents;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: gas system means a system of gas equipment that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is installed in premises and is downstream of an outlet of a service meter,
uses liquefied petroleum gas and is downstream of a second stage regulator,
is installed other than by or on behalf of a gas company and is upstream of the outlet of a meter or upstream of a second stage regulator,
is installed at a propane bulk plant,
is a vehicle fuel system or a vehicle gas system, or
is used for the production, handling and utilization of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: digester gas in a wastewater treatment plant,
landfill gas at a landfill site, or
biogas.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for this regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Safety Standards Act;

appliance means a regulated product that converts gas into energy and includes any valves, controls, fittings and components attached to or connected to it or intended to be attached to or connected to it;
apprentice has the same meaning as in the Skilled Trades BC Act;
B.C. Natural Gas and Propane Code means the code adopted under section 30 (2);
biogas means a gas produced in a digester at a location other than at a wastewater treatment plant;
city gate means the plant or premises where gas received from a pipeline is metered, reduced in pressure and prepared for distribution to individual users of the gas;
container means a cylinder or tank used to store

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: propane, or
natural gas in a gaseous state to be used in a vehicle fuel system;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: conversion burner means a burner designed to supply gaseous fuel to an appliance originally designed to use another fuel;
digester gas means a gas produced from the biological treatment of sewage and which is composed of methane, carbon dioxide and hydrogen sulphide or any combination of them;
distribution main means a pipe used for the transmission and distribution of gas at a pressure of 700 kPa gauge or less for any distance between a city gate and a service pipe;
fan assisted appliance means a Category 1 appliance as defined in CSA B149.1;
fully detached dwelling means any detached building containing only one dwelling unit if occupied or intended by the owner to be occupied as a permanent residence;
gas means any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: natural gas, manufactured gas, liquefied petroleum gas, digester gas, landfill gas, biogas or a mixture or dilution of any of them;
hydrogen;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: gas company means a person engaged in the sale or distribution of gas in British Columbia;
gas fitter means an individual who has obtained a certificate of qualification as a gas fitter under this regulation;
gas installation means a facility or system, including fittings, that is owned or operated by a gas company and is used to store, convey, measure or regulate gas;
gas utility means a gas company that owns or operates a gas installation for conveying gas from a city gate or bulk storage facility to the outlet of an individual user's meter set;
homeowner means the owner of a fully detached dwelling who lives in or intends to live in that dwelling as a permanent residence;
landfill gas means a gas composed of methane, carbon dioxide, water and hydrogen sulphide, or any combination of them, produced from the decomposition of organic waste material at a landfill site;
licence means a licence issued by a provincial safety manager in respect of gas systems and gas equipment;
licensed gas contractor means a person who holds a licence as a licensed contractor in respect of gas systems;

liquefied petroleum gas means a gas composed of a mixture of propane, propylene, butane and butylenes and other hydrocarbons that are gaseous under normal atmospheric conditions of pressure and temperature but can be liquefied under moderate pressure at ambient temperatures;
manufactured gas means a gas obtained by the destructive distillation of carbon derived from coal, coke or oil;
meter means a device that measures the volume of gas passing through it, and includes any components that are attached or connected to it;
natural draft appliance means a Category 1 appliance as defined in CSA B149.1 that has a draft hood or draft diverter and is not equipped with a mechanical device for supplying combustion air;
natural gas means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a naturally occurring mixture of hydrocarbon gases composed predominantly of methane but that may also contain ethane, nitrogen and propane;
a mixture referred to in paragraph (a) into which hydrogen has been injected;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: pipeline has the meaning in the Energy Resource Activities Act;
propane bulk plant means a facility that is used primarily for the storage of liquefied petroleum gas before distribution to persons or places outside the facility;

regulatory authority means the ministry or a local government which provides for an inspection service and has authority to require inspection of regulated work in respect of gas in an area of British Columbia;
service meter means a meter that is installed by or on behalf of a gas company;
service pipe means a pipe installed by or on behalf of a gas company for the transmission of gas from a distribution main to a meter on the land or premises of the purchaser of the gas;
SkilledTradesBC certificate has the same meaning as "certificate of qualification" in the Skilled Trades BC Act;
vehicle has the meaning in the Motor Vehicle Act;
vehicle fuel system means gas equipment installed on a vehicle for the provision of motive power;
vehicle gas system means gas equipment used for purposes other than motive power and which is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: used or designed to be used in connection with or for the purpose of the use, distribution or storage of gas, and
installed on any vehicle or used or designed to be used to supply or dispense gas for use in, on or by a vehicle;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: vehicle refuelling appliance means a natural gas compressor package, not containing storage, that is designed for use for unattended refuelling of vehicle fuel systems;
vent means a conduit or passageway for conveying the products of combustion from a gas appliance to the outside air.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application of this regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation does not apply to any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a pressure vessel as defined in the Power Engineer, Boiler, Pressure Vessel and Refrigeration Safety Regulation;

any pipe in which anything is transmitted at a pressure of greater than 700 kPa gauge, other than gas equipment installed in premises downstream of an outlet of a gas company's service meter or gas equipment in a vehicle gas system or vehicle fuel system;
a piping system used to refine or process gas in any way;
any of the following that is approved under the Motor Vehicle Safety Act (Canada):

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an internal combustion engine;
a turbine;
any other prime mover;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a pipeline;
a vehicle fuel system approved under the Motor Vehicle Safety Act (Canada).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Relation to the Safety Standards General Regulation
bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation is subject to the Safety Standards General Regulation.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Individuals Who May Perform Regulated Work

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Individuals who may perform regulated work

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An individual must not perform regulated work in respect of a gas system or gas equipment unless the individual

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: holds a certificate of qualification issued under this Part,
is authorized to perform regulated work in respect of gas without holding a certificate of qualification,
has successfully completed a training program recognized by a provincial safety manager,
holds another certificate of qualification to perform limited work in respect of gas under the Act,
is a homeowner acting in accordance with section 24, or
is permitted to do so in accordance with section 5 of the Safety Standards General Regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An authorized employee of a gas company or an individual who has permission from a gas company may work only with the equipment owned by the gas utility.
An individual must not do welding on metallic gas piping unless the individual holds a pressure welder's certificate of qualification issued under the Act.
An individual must not install or interconnect any non-metallic pipe unless the individual has successfully completed training recognized by the provincial safety manager.

A provincial safety manager may, in a permit, require that the regulated work be done by an individual with special welding skills or other skills that are necessary to complete the regulated work safely.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: What all applicants for a certificate of qualification must do

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: All applicants for a certificate of qualification, except applicants for a special purpose certificate, must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: pass an examination for that class of certificate, and
fulfill any other requirements for that class of certificate as detailed in this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 45/2017, s. (b) (ii).]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Class A gas fitter certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for a class A gas fitter's certificate of qualification must have

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: successfully completed training in a gas fitting program recognized by a provincial safety manager, and
held a class B gas fitter's certificate of qualification for at least 2 years.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A class A gas fitter certificate of qualification entitles the holder to perform the installation or alteration of any gas system, except vehicle fuel systems, under an appropriate permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Class B gas fitter certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for a class B certificate of qualification must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: have successfully completed a gas fitting course recognized by a provincial safety manager and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: hold a SkilledTradesBC certificate in gas fitting, plumbing, steamfitting, refrigeration or sprinkler fitting, or
have held a gas utility certificate of qualification for at least 2 years,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be an apprentice in a gas fitting program recognized by a provincial safety manager, or

have an equivalent combination of experience and training acceptable to a provincial safety manager and have attained the standing acceptable to a provincial safety manager in a gas fitting course and examination that have been recognized by a provincial safety manager.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A class B gas fitter certificate of qualification entitles the holder to perform the installation or alteration of the following gas systems under an appropriate permit:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an appliance with an input of 120 kW or less that displays a label or mark as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a certification mark;
an approval mark issued under section 10 of the Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: piping and vents.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 150/2011, s. 1.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to the work referred to in subsection (2), a person is entitled, if the conditions of subsection (4) are met, to perform the installation or alteration, under an appropriate permit, of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a fan assisted appliance;
a natural draft appliance;
any other appliance, if the appliance has an input of 220 kW or less.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (3), the conditions that must be met are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the appliance must display

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a certification mark, or
an approval mark issued under section 10 of the Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person must hold a valid class B gas fitter certificate of qualification that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was issued on or before March 31, 2020,
is marked with the designation "(GP)", and
entitles the person to perform the work referred to in subsection (3).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Class A or B gas fitter may do limited electrical work

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of a class A or class B gas fitter's certificate of qualification may, while employed by a licensed gas contractor or working under an operating permit, perform electrical work that is restricted to the installation, repair and maintenance of electrical wiring for solid, liquid and gaseous-fuel-fired heating equipment for any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: connecting branch circuit wiring to the heating equipment integral connection box from a junction box or disconnect mounted in close proximity to the heating equipment;
class 2 circuit wiring up to a rated output of 100 Volt amps;
low voltage controls or 24 volt thermostats.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 134/2009, s. 8.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of a class A gas fitter's certificate of qualification may, in the circumstances described in subsection (1), perform electrical work that is restricted to the installation, repair and maintenance of electrical wiring for solid, liquid and gaseous-fuel-fired heating equipment for 3 phase motors or controllers integral to the heating equipment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duty of gas fitter to notify of need to repair
bcl:section.bcl:text: If it comes to the attention of a gas fitter that there is a need to have regulated work done by a gas company to any part of a supply system containing unmeasured gas, the gas fitter must immediately notify the gas company of that need.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gas fitter may make temporary repairs
bcl:section.bcl:text: If it comes to the attention of a gas fitter that gas is leaking from any part of a gas supply system containing unmeasured gas, the gas fitter must notify the gas company that permanent repairs are necessary and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: safely isolate the system until repairs can be made, or
make necessary temporary repairs.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gas appliance service certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for an appliance service certificate of qualification must have successfully completed a course in gas appliance servicing recognized by a provincial safety manager.

A gas appliance service certificate of qualification entitles the holder to perform the servicing of the following gas systems while employed by a licensed gas contractor or under an appropriate permit:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: gas appliances installed for residential use;
light commercial appliances up to an input of 82 kW.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gas piping certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for a gas piping certificate of qualification must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: hold a SkilledTradesBC certificate acceptable to a provincial safety manager, or
have had a minimum of 2 years gas fitting experience acceptable to a provincial safety manager.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A gas piping certificate of qualification entitles the holder to install and test gas piping under an appropriate permit.
The holder of a gas piping certificate of qualification must not install, service or commission gas appliances.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Recreation vehicle installation and service certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for a recreation vehicle installation and service certificate of qualification

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must hold a recreation vehicle service technician SkilledTradesBC certificate or an equivalent recreation vehicle certificate with an interprovincial red seal endorsement, or
must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: have successfully completed a course in recreation vehicle appliance installation and servicing recognized by a provincial safety manager, and
provide documented evidence, acceptable to a provincial safety manager, of a minimum of 2Â years experience in the installation or repair of recreation vehicle appliances and piping.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A recreation vehicle installation and service certificate of qualification entitles the holder to maintain, alter, repair and install vehicle gas systems in recreational vehicles under an appropriate permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Liquefied petroleum gas vehicle conversion certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for a liquefied petroleum gas vehicle conversion certificate of qualification must have successfully completed a course in the conversion of vehicles to liquefied petroleum gas recognized by a provincial safety manager and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: hold a 3 year automotive service technician SkilledTradesBC certificate or an equivalent 3 year automotive trade certificate, or
provide documented evidence, acceptable to a provincial safety manager, of a minimum of 3 years of automotive tune-up experience.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A liquefied petroleum gas vehicle conversion certificate of qualification entitles the holder to maintain, alter, repair and install liquefied petroleum gas vehicle fuel systems under an appropriate permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Compressed natural gas vehicle conversion certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for a compressed natural gas vehicle conversion certificate of qualification must have successfully completed a course in the conversion of vehicles to compressed natural gas recognized by a provincial safety manager, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: hold a 3 year automotive service technician SkilledTradesBC certificate, or an equivalent 3 year automotive trade certificate, acceptable to a provincial safety manager, or
provide documented evidence, acceptable to a provincial safety manager, of a minimum of 3 years of automotive tune-up experience.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A compressed natural gas vehicle conversion certificate of qualification entitles the holder to maintain, alter, repair and install compressed natural gas vehicle fuel systems under an operating permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Compressed natural gas and liquefied petroleum gas vehicle conversion certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for a compressed natural gas and liquefied petroleum gas vehicle conversion certificate of qualification must have successfully completed a course in the conversion of vehicles to compressed natural gas and liquefied petroleum gas recognized by a provincial safety manager, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: hold a 3 year automotive service technician SkilledTradesBC certificate or an equivalent 3 year automotive trade certificate, acceptable to a provincial safety manager, or
provide documented evidence, acceptable to a provincial safety manager, of a minimum of 3 years of automotive tune-up experience.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A compressed natural gas and liquefied petroleum gas vehicle conversion certificate of qualification entitles the holder to maintain, alter, repair and install compressed natural gas and liquefied petroleum gas vehicle fuel systems under an operating permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gas venting certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for a gas venting certificate of qualification must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: hold a SkilledTradesBC certificate in sheet metal, plumbing, steamfitting, refrigeration or sprinkler fitting acceptable to a provincial safety manager, or
have an equivalent combination of experience and training acceptable to a provincial safety manager.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A gas venting certificate of qualification entitles the holder to alter, repair and install venting under an appropriate permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gas utility certificate of qualification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for a gas utility certificate of qualification must have successfully completed 2 years of training in utility installations acceptable to a provincial safety manager.
A gas utility certificate of qualification entitles the holder, while employed by a gas utility and after gas service is interrupted, to do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: relight gas equipment with an input of 120 kW or less;
replace thermocouples;
make other minor repairs;
do safety checks.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Special purpose gas certificate of qualification
bcl:section.bcl:text: A special purpose certificate of qualification entitles the holder to perform only the regulated work specified by the certificate and only under the conditions specifically endorsed on the certificate.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 134/2009, s. 8.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Field safety representative not required for gas contractor's licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 6 (a) of the Safety Standards General Regulation does not apply to an application for a gas contractor's licence under this Division.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Duties of Licensed Gas Contractor and Permit Holder

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duties of a licensed gas contractor and permit holder
bcl:section.bcl:text: A licensed gas contractor or holder of a permit must not allow an individual to do the regulated work coming within the scope of the licence or permit unless the individual is authorized to do so in accordance with this Part.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Permits that may be issued by a local government
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a local government administers a gas inspection service under an agreement under section 5 of the Act, a safety officer appointed by the local government may issue an installation permit for only the following kinds of regulated work in respect of gas equipment or gas systems:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: regulated work in a fully detached dwelling serviced by an individual service meter and supplied with gas at a pressure of 14.0 kPa gauge or less;
regulated work in any premises other than a fully detached dwelling, if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the meter is supplied with gas at a pressure of 14.0 kPa gauge or less, and
the total connected load for the meter is 120 kW or less.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Homeowner may perform work under a permit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A homeowner may apply for an installation permit to perform regulated work with respect to gas equipment in a fully detached dwelling if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: no person is being paid to do, or assist the owner in doing, the work, and
no part of the dwelling is rented to any person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 26 does not apply to a homeowner who performs regulated work under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Drawings to accompany installation permit application
bcl:section.bcl:text: An applicant for an installation permit for a gas system or proposed gas system must, if required by a provincial safety manager, provide drawings in support of the application and pay any required fees.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Installation permit is also authorization

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless otherwise provided in the installation permit, if the holder of an installation permit complies with sectionÂ 34, an installation permit issued for regulated work in respect of a gas system is sufficient authorization for the use of the gas system.

An installation permit for any of the following is authorization to begin the installation or reinstallation of the appliance but not to test or use the appliance until it has passed inspection or an inspection has been waived by the regulatory authority on conditions specified by the regulatory authority:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any direct-fired non-recirculating type make-up heater;
a conversion burner, except if it is to be installed in a single family dwelling and has an input of 120Â kW or less;
a commercial or industrial conversion burner;
any direct fired equipment;
a forced draft appliance over 409 600 BTU/hour.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (2) a provincial safety manager may include in an installation permit permission to ignite or operate a regulated product before inspection under conditions specified in the permit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Field safety representative not required for installation permit
bcl:section.bcl:text: An installation permit issued under this regulation is not required to name a field safety representative.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirements concerning operating permits

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The owner of any of the following must apply to a provincial safety manager for an operating permit:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an industrial or commercial establishment with appliances used for processing or process water heating with a total input greater than 1Â 500Â kW used for purposes other than space heating or domestic water heating;
a propane bulk plant;
an establishment for filling containers with gas;
an establishment where regulated products are installed on vehicles as part of the vehicle fuel system;
an establishment where regulated products are installed on vehicles for purposes other than vehicle fuel systems;
an establishment that maintains portable heating appliances of input equal to or less than 300Â kW;
a portable appliance with an input greater than 300 kW that can be transported from site to site;
a gas utility.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: All regulated work under an operating permit under subsection (1) (a), (b) or (g) must be performed by a gas fitter or under the direct supervision of a gas fitter and the gas fitter or field safety representative must complete any records required by the permit.

An individual who performs regulated work under an operating permit issued under subsection (1) (d) or (e) must hold the appropriate certificate of qualification and must complete and maintain any records required by the permit.

The operator of an establishment who applies for a permit under subsection (1) (d) or (e) must provide, in the required form, a bond, in an amount specified by a provincial safety manager, before being issued an operating permit.

The holder of an operating permit must keep an accurate record of all regulated work authorized under the permit, including the location and types of the appliances on which regulated work is performed, and must maintain those records for a period of 7 years.
If an operating permit has been issued under subsection (1) (g) the appliance may be operated only by an individual who has been appropriately trained by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the manufacturer of the appliance, or
the manufacturer's representative.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of an operating permit issued under subsection (1) (a) or (b) must notify a safety manager in writing of any addition to the gas system.

An individual must not transfer liquefied petroleum gas or liquefied natural gas from one container to another unless the individual has successfully completed a training course recognized by a provincial safety manager and holds a certificate issued following that training course.

The owner of portable equipment that is covered under an operating permit issued under subsection (1) (g) must, in writing, notify a safety officer of the location and relocation of the portable equipment each time that the portable equipment is moved to a new site.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duties of owners and licensed gas contractors in commercial and industrial buildings

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: commercial building has the meaning in CSA B149.1;
industrial building has the meaning in CSA B149.1.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Owners of commercial or industrial buildings that contain appliances with total inputs of 1 500 kW or less but greater than 220Â kW must ensure that those appliances are properly serviced, repaired and maintained by a licensed gas contractor.

An owner of a commercial or industrial building must, on the request of a safety manager or safety officer, supply accurate records of any servicing or repairs done in respect to the appliances in subsection (2).

A licensed gas contractor must, on an annual basis, supply a provincial safety manager with documentation, in a form that is acceptable to the safety manager, in respect of any regulated work referred to in subsection (2) unless that work is exempted under the regulations from requiring inspection requests or reporting procedures.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Canadian gas standards adopted as B.C. Natural Gas and Propane Code

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, national code means the following codes or standards:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: CSA B149.1-20 Natural gas and propane installation code;
CSA B149.2-20 Propane storage and handling code;
CSA B149.3-20 Code for the field approval of fuel-burning appliances and equipment, including, as normative, Annex J Mobile outdoor food service unit;
CSA B149.5-20 Installation code for propane fuel systems and containers on motor vehicles;
CSA Z662-19 Oil and gas pipeline systems;
CSA/ANSI B149.6-20 Code for digester gas, landfill gas, and biogas generation and utilization;
CSA B108-18 Natural gas refuelling stations installation code;
CSA B109-17 Natural gas for vehicles installation code;
CAN/BNQ 1784-000-2022 Canadian Hydrogen Installation Code.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The national code is adopted by reference, with the changes set out in the Schedule, as the B.C. Natural Gas and Propane Code.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Installation and use of gas appliances

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not install an appliance unless the appliance conforms to the conditions of one of the following paragraphs:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the appliance displays

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a certification mark, or
an approval mark issued under section 10 of the Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the appliance

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: has a maximum input below 120Â kW,
is being reinstalled in the same location from which it was uninstalled, and
has been examined, repaired if necessary and verified to be in safe working condition by a gas fitter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not use a portable gas heater for temporary heating unless the conditions of both of the following paragraphs are met:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the heater bears a current decal, valid for 2 years, indicating that the heater is in safe working condition;
the decal referred to in paragraph (a) is applied by a person who holds an appropriate certificate of qualification.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 170/2018, s. (a) (iii).]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Dealers to maintain records of gas appliances
bcl:section.bcl:text: A dealer must keep, for a period of at least 7 years, a record respecting every gas appliance that the dealer sells, showing the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name and address of the purchaser;
the place of installation;
the type and model number of the appliance.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duty to inform regulatory authority of completion of work for inspection

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On completion of each phase of the gas system authorized by a permit, the holder of the permit, the gas fitter or the field safety representative that represents the holder of the permit must immediately inform the regulatory authority that the regulated work has been performed in accordance with the Act and request an inspection.

On final completion of the regulated work authorized by a permit, the holder of the permit must immediately complete a notification of completion, installation or alteration form and mail or deliver the completed form to the appropriate regulatory authority.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Safety officer's certificate of qualification
bcl:section.bcl:text: An application for a gas safety officer's certificate of qualification must include proof, acceptable to a provincial safety manager, that the applicant has been the holder of a class A or class B gas fitter's certificate of qualification and employed as a gas fitter for a minimum of 5Â years.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Requirements and Procedures for Installation and Excavations

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Connection for pressure gauge to be satisfactory
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a safety officer requests a connection for a pressure gauge or a pressure recorder, a person who installs a gas installation must supply the pressure gauge or connection.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedures for a gas installation in vicinity of underground structures

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not install a gas installation or allow one to be installed so that the gas installation passes through or interferes with any underground structure that is not solely for the use of a gas installation without the written permission of the owner of the underground structure.

A person, unless allowed to do so as a condition of a permit to perform regulated work with respect to gas, must not begin to install or construct an underground structure that will interfere with a gas installation by passing over, passing under or enclosing the gas installation until an agreement has been entered into with the gas company for the removal or alteration of the gas installation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duties of persons intending to construct near gas installation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who intends to construct an underground structure within one metre of a gas installation must notify the gas company operating in the area at least 2 business days before starting the excavation for the structure.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedures for excavations

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not excavate or cause any excavating to be done in the vicinity of a gas installation that is or could be in any way damaging or dangerous to a gas installation.

A person who intends to excavate must, at least 2 business days before the person intends to excavate, request from the gas company serving that area, or its agent, information on the location of all underground gas installations in the vicinity of the proposed excavation.
A person must not excavate until

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person ascertains that a request has been made under subsection (2) and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the information was provided by the gas company under subsection (5) and that information revealed that there is no gas installation in the vicinity, or

the information was provided by the gas company under subsection (5) and that information revealed that there is a gas installation in the vicinity and that installation has been indicated in accordance with subsection (5), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person ascertains that information provided by the gas company in respect of the lack of indicators under paragraph (a) (i) or the presence of indicators under paragraph (a) (ii) was supplied by the gas company within 10 days before beginning of the excavation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the excavator is not satisfied under subsection (3) (b), the person must verify the information with the gas company before excavating.
On receiving a request under subsection (2) a gas company must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide the information requested within 2 business days, and

in a manner that is clear and easily understood, indicate the location of gas installations owned or operated by it in the area where the excavation is intended to be made by one or more of the following methods as appropriate for conditions at the excavation site:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: providing a plan or listing of facility locations by measurement from an ascertainable point on the surface;
surface staking;
surface marking.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Prelocated or marked gas installations must be considered to lie within a zone equal to the diameter of the gas installation plus one metre on either side of the location indicated by the gas company under subsection (5).

The indicated location of gas installations must be confirmed by the excavator by means of hand digging and the excavator must expose the gas installations at a sufficient number of locations to determine their exact positions and depths before using mechanized excavation equipment for any purpose other than breaking the surface cover.

For existing gas installations of non-metallic material not provided with tracer wires, the gas company must, on request, indicate the location, including all changes in direction, of the installation by stakes or paint or both, at intervals not exceeding 100 metres, and subsection (7) applies.
If an excavator finds that the gas installation is not within the limits described by the gas company,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the excavator must so advise the gas company,
the gas company must immediately assist in locating and exposing the installation for the excavator, and
mechanized excavation must not be carried on in the vicinity until the installation has been located and exposed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: As the excavation work progresses, the excavator must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: maintain and keep visible all markings placed by the gas company that identify the location of the gas installation, or
if it is impractical to maintain the markings, make other arrangements to ensure that the location of the gas installation is obvious to any observer.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: No probing to locate gas installations
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must not probe with pointed tools to locate gas installations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirements for blasting in vicinity of gas installation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who intends to blast in the vicinity of a gas installation must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: comply with sections 37 to 39, and
notify the relevant gas company at least 3 business days before blasting.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person has already complied with sections 37 to 39 and discovers in the process of construction that blasting is required, the person must notify the relevant gas company at least 24 hours, counted only on business days, before blasting is to start.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Emergency excavation procedures

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Sections 37 to 40 do not apply to emergency excavations if there may be an imminent danger to life, health or property.
A person who excavates under subsection (1) must give notice of the excavation to the relevant gas company operating in that area as soon as practicable.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedure for backfilling an excavation when gas installation exposed
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who backfills an excavation that has exposed a gas installation must do all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: take care not to damage the installation, its protective wrapping or any cathodic protection devices;
thoroughly tamp the backfill under the gas installation;
adequately support the gas installation to the satisfaction of the gas company and ensure that it will remain in its original line and grade during settlement of the backfill;
ensure that the backfilling will not diminish lateral support for unexposed parts of the gas installation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedure if gas escapes
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who causes damage to a gas installation which results in the escape of gas must immediately take the steps reasonable in the circumstances to do all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: notify the persons in any premises that may be affected;
notify the gas company;
warn all persons in any nearby building in which a gas odour is present to evacuate the building;
notify a member of the police force having jurisdiction in the place where the installation is located;
extinguish all flames and sources of ignition in the vicinity of the installation;
notify the nearest fire department;
warn traffic, vehicles and pedestrians not to enter the area rendered hazardous by the damage.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedure if there is damage to gas installation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who causes damage to a gas installation, whether or not gas is escaping as a result, must immediately notify the relevant gas company of the damage.
Serious damage reported to a gas company under subsection (1) must promptly be reported by the gas company to a provincial safety manager.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedure when gas installation exposed
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who exposes more than 3 metres of a gas installation must immediately notify the relevant gas company and securely support the gas installation, to the satisfaction of the gas company, on its original line and grade at intervals of not more than 3Â metres.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedure if gas fittings exposed
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who exposes any bell and spigot joints, mechanical couplings, valves or line insulators must immediately notify the relevant gas company and adequately support the exposed fittings, to the satisfaction of the gas company, such that no strain is placed on the gas installation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedures in respect of cathodic protection devices

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person working in the vicinity of a gas installation must take all necessary precautions to ensure that no damage is done to insulators, test wires, sacrificial anodes, anode beds, rectifier wires and other cathodic protection devices.
If damage is done to any cathodic protection device the person who causes the damage must immediately report the damage to the relevant gas company.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedure if damage to protective wrapping occurs
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a person has in any way damaged protective wrapping on a gas installation the person must do all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: report the damage to the gas company before the damage is repaired;
rewrap the gas installation in accordance with the current standards of the gas company;
ensure that the rewrapped section is not backfilled until the gas company authorizes the backfilling.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Test charts or reports to be provided on request

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A gas company or gas equipment installer must, on the request of a provincial safety manager, provide copies of test pressure charts or test reports, or both, for any gas installation that the gas company or gas installer is responsible for.
A gas company must provide a report of the total length of distribution gas line extension installed by the gas company in any calendar year to a provincial safety manager.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Provincial safety manager may require pressure tests
bcl:section.bcl:text: A provincial safety manager may, at any reasonable time, require that a pressure test of a gas installation be conducted by a gas company in the presence of a safety officer.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duty of gas company to file construction standards with provincial safety manager

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A gas company must file with a provincial safety manager its standards of construction and any amendments made to the standards.
On request of a safety officer, a gas company must make any gas installation plan for which the gas company is responsible available to the safety officer within 24 hours.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Installation and Repair Procedures for Appliances and Gas Systems

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Turning gas supply on and off

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not turn off a gas supply unless there is an imminent safety hazard and the person notifies all affected consumers.
If a gas supply has been turned off, a person must not turn the supply on again until the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: notifies all affected consumers, and
carefully checks all outlets and pilots to ascertain that they are relighted or turned off.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Unrepairable appliance

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who finds any appliance or gas equipment beyond repair or in an unsafe condition must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: place the appliance or gas equipment out of service, and
promptly notify a safety officer of its condition and location.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the initial notification under subsection (1) (b) is verbal, it must be promptly confirmed by a written statement setting out the facts.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duties of owner of rental premises concerning gas appliances
bcl:section.bcl:text: The owner of rental premises must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: post a notice, of a permanent nature, respecting the safe operation of an appliance, on the premises in a conspicuous location where it can be seen by any person using the appliance,
ensure that appliances on the rental premises are maintained in a safe condition, and
maintain accurate records of maintenance and servicing performed on the gas system on the rental premises.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gas fitter's tag to be affixed on completion of work
bcl:section.bcl:text: When a gas system installation has been completed, a gas fitter must affix a tag, bearing the gas fitter's name, certificate of qualification number, type of appliance and date of affixation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if there is a building, to a pipe of that gas system at the point of entry into the building or at the point where the gas pipe enters the appliance, or
if there is no building, at the gas meter or at the point where the gas pipe enters the appliance.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Adjustments on connection to gas line
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who connects gas to an appliance must do all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: adjust and test each appliance the person connects so that it will operate in accordance with the manufacturer's specifications;
adjust the input rate to the required rate by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: replacing a fixed orifice size,
changing the adjustment of an adjustable orifice, or
if a regulator is provided, by readjusting the gas pressure regulator outlet;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: ensure that the appliance vents in a safe and proper manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Testing after disconnection
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a person disconnects the outlet of a service meter from the house piping the person must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: remake the joint at the service meter outlet, and
turn the service meter on again only after testing the house piping and ensuring that no other outlets are open.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice to gas company if input greater than 45 kW

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not install an appliance or cause an appliance to be installed on a gas system without first giving notice to the gas company that supplies that gas if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the installation of the appliance will increase the total connected hourly input ratings of the appliances served by a service meter to greater than 45Â kW, or
the total connected hourly input rating of the appliances served by a service meter is greater than 45Â kW.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A notice under subsection (1) must state the type and input rating of the appliance and the address of the premises in which the appliance is to be installed.
This section does not apply to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a vehicle gas system, or
gas equipment at a propane bulk plant.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Odorization

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: All gas that does not naturally possess a distinctive odour so that its presence in the atmosphere is readily detectable at all gas concentrations equal to or higher than 1/5 of the lower explosive limit must have an odorant added to make it so detectable.
Subsection (1) does not apply to gas delivered for further processing or for use if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the gas equipment is equipped with gas detection devices that will detect any gas leakage at an atmospheric concentration equal to or higher than 1/5 of the lower explosive limit, or
the odorant would serve no useful purpose as a warning agent.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Information Requests for Existing Gas System

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Information requests for an existing gas system
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who requests information from a provincial safety manager about an existing gas system must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide the written consent of the owner of the premises where the gas system is installed, and
pay any required fee.

bcl:centertext.in:strong:
Variations for B.C. Natural Gas and Propane Code
to the National Code

in:em.in:strong: 1 The following clauses are added after Clause 4.3.8 of CSA B149.1-20 Natural gas and propane installation code:

bcl:section.bcl:text: The installer must ensure that no portion of an energized gas piping system is altered or disconnected prior to isolation of that portion of the gas system from the source supply.

The installer must ensure that any alterations of an existing gas piping system include a testing procedure in accordance with Clause 6.22 to ensure that the gas piping system is gas-tight at the completion of the work.

in:em.in:strong: 1.1 Paragraph (b) of Clause 4.14.6 of CSA B149.1-20 is repealed and the following substituted:

bcl:schedule.bcl:indent2: (b) the clearance between the appliance and the edge of the roof or other hazard shall be at least 6 feet (2 m), but this clearance may be reduced to 3 feet (1 m) if a permanent guard rail or equivalent protection is provided;Â andÂ .

in:em.in:strong: 2 The following clause is added after Clause 4.14.7 of CSA B149.1-20:

bcl:section.bcl:text: When it is considered necessary to install an appliance within screening or within a roof well (a depressed area on a roof), the following additional requirements apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: screening shall have a free opening of not less than 50% of the area of each side;
there shall be no roof, cover or screens over the well enclosure;
each appliance shall be installed with not less than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 36 inches (90 cm) clearance from any side of the appliance, or
the clearance required by the manufacturer of the appliance,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: whichever is greater;
the walls of a screen or roof well shall

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: be no higher than the height of the appliance when it is vented atmospherically, or
not exceed an angle of 45 from the top of the screen or roof well to the vent outlet of a power or fan assisted venting system;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: when an appliance is installed with screening consisting of 2 solid walls or is installed in a roof well, fresh air shall not be taken from within the enclosure unless a 20 foot (6 m) separation can be maintained between the vent outlet and the fresh air inlet;

an appliance installed outdoors in an area which is subject to an ambient temperature lower than -40F (-40C) shall be approved by a recognized testing agency for -60F (-51.1C), or be an appliance approved for operation to -40F (-40C) and equipped with a low ambient temperature switch.

in:strong.in:em: 2.1 The following clause is added after Clause 4.25.10 of CSA B149.1-20:

bcl:section.bcl:text: Hydronic Heating Appliances and Equipment

All hydronic heating appliances and equipment must be installed and used in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions, this Code, and clauses 4.5.3.2, 4.5.4, 5.1, 5.3.1, 5.3.2 and 12.4 of the CSA-B214-16 Installation code for hydronic heating systems.
Gas Appliances Installed in Bedrooms and Bathrooms
A gas appliance installed in a bathroom with a door shall be of the direct vent type only.

A gas appliance installed in a closet or a small room having access only through a bathroom, bedroom or bed-sitting room shall be of the direct vent type or have combustion and ventilation air supplied to the closet or small room. If any exhaust fan affects the operation of a gas appliance, the gas appliance shall be isolated from the bathroom using a sealed opening or door closer.
A gas appliance installed in a bedroom shall meet all of the following requirements:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the appliance must be of the automatic temperature controlled type;
the appliance must be equipped with a pressure regulator;
the appliance must have a 100% safety shut-off control valve;
the appliance must be vented and meet the requirements for combustion air specified by section 8.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A gas appliance (fireplace) installed as a divider between a bedroom and bathroom shall meet all the requirements for an installation in a bedroom. In addition, the gas appliance shall be sealed from the bathroom using material that is impact resistant and thermal shock proof. Clearance to the tub must be maintained to prevent accidental injury from the hot surface of the appliance.

in:em.in:strong: 2.2 Paragraph (a) of Clause 5.6.4 of CSA B149.1-20 is repealed and the following substituted:

bcl:schedule.bcl:indent2: (a) the service regulator is certified to CSA 6.18 and equipped with an overpressure shut-off device that vents gas at a rate not exceeding 2.5 ft3/h (0.0706 m3/h);Â .

in:em.in:strong: 2.3 Clause 6.9.2 of CSA B149.1-20 is repealed and the following substituted:

bcl:section.bcl:text: Piping of NPS 2-1/2 to 4 shall be either press-connect fittings certified to CSA 6.32 (ANSI LC-4) or welded pipe joints. Piping greater than NPS 4 shall be welded pipe joints.

in:em.in:strong: 3 The following clauses are added after Clause 6.15.14 of CSA B149.1-20:

bcl:section.bcl:text: A metallic piping system laid underground shall be cathodically protected regardless of pressure. The only exceptions are construction camps (if the system is to be used for a limited time), nonmetallic pipe and copper pipe or tube.
To ensure electrical continuity when a mechanical fitting is used, each fitting shall be bonded over by No. 6TW cable attached to the piping by either

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: cadwelding, or
brazing.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Cathodically protected underground piping shall be buried not less than 12 inches (300 mm) horizontally from all other underground pipes or conduits, except by special permission.

Where an underground gas pipe crosses another underground pipe or conduit, a minimum clearance of 2 inches (50 mm) shall be provided either above or below the gas line in accordance with the requirements of section 6.15.
All piping in the protected system shall be electrically insulated from all other piping by means of suitable electrical insulating fittings. Anodes shall be magnesium.

in:em.in:strong: 4 The following clauses are added after Clause 7.18.7 of CSA B149.1-20:

bcl:schedule.bcl:indent2: (c) The instructions to the lessee by the lessor shall include, but not be restricted to, the following:
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent3: (vii) moving the construction heater from location to location.
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent2: (d) Maintenance of the construction heater is the responsibility of the lessor. This work shall include maintenance of the appliance, regulator, hose and fittings.

in:em.in:strong: 5 The following clause is added after Clause 7.18.10 of CSA B149.1-20:

bcl:section.bcl:text: A piping permit is required for the laying of temporary gas piping to connect a construction heater. This work shall be done by a qualified gas fitter.

in:em.in:strong: 6 Clause 7.25.4 of CSA B149.1-20 is repealed.
8 Clause 8.3.6 of CSA B149.1-20 is repealed and the following substituted:

bcl:section.bcl:text: An air supply inlet opening from the outdoors shall

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: have a minimum vertical distance of 24 inches (600 mm) between the bottom of the intake grill and the finished grade at the point of intake in order to prevent obstruction of the combustion air intake by snow or other material, and
not be taken from a car port.

in:em.in:strong: 9 The following clause is added after Clause 8.8.2 of CSA B149.1-20:

bcl:section.bcl:text: When the air supply is provided by mechanical means from the outdoors for natural draft, partial fan assisted, fan assisted or power draft assisted burners, the air quantity supplied by the fan shall be based on 30 cubic feet (0.85 cubic meters) of outside air for each 1 000 BTU/hour of gas supplied to the burners.

in:em.in:strong: 10 The following sections are added after Clause 8.14.13 of CSA B149.1-20:

bcl:section.bcl:text: Direct Vent Fireplace Vents
A direct vent fireplace terminal location shall not be installed in any area which is not allocated to the occupancy in which the fireplace is installed.
In a structure with 3 walls and a roof, the terminal shall not be installed

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: more than 72 inches (183 cm) from the outside opening,
on any wall that has an opening between the terminal and the open side of the structure, or
below 84 inches (218 cm) from a deck, patio or balcony without a certified guard.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A direct vent fireplace shall not be installed

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: less than 24 inches below a ceiling or soffit that has perforations (openings) unless the ceiling or soffit is sealed for a distance of 24 inches (61 cm) on either side of the centre line of the vent termination,
less than 6 feet (183 cm) under a window that opens on a horizontal plane, or
directly under a balcony or deck constructed such that there are openings in the deck surface.
